Interface JSIGame


  • public interface JSIGame

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void computeState()
      Allows the user to compute and needed state representation variables outside of the default getState method
      int getLevel()
      Gets the current level in game

      Gets the current number of lives

      Gets the status of the game

      Gets the valid actions for any given game

    • Method Detail

      • getScore

        int getScore()
        Gets the current score in game
        Returns:
        an integer that represents number of points earned in any given game

      • getLives

        int getLives()
        Gets the current number of lives
        Returns:
        an integer that represents the amount of lives player0 has in game if this feature is present, else 0

      • getLevel

        int getLevel()
        Gets the current level in game
        Returns:
        an integer that represents the level in game if this feature is present, else 0

      • getState

        int[] getState()
        Allows the user to build a set of values from memory or computation
        Returns:
        an integer array that represents the current state of the game

      • computeState

        void computeState()
        Allows the user to compute and needed state representation variables outside of the default getState method

      • getPlayableStatus

        boolean getPlayableStatus()
        Gets the status of the game
        Returns:
        a boolean that represents if the game is still going/playable or not

      • getValidActions

        default int[][] getValidActions()
        Gets the valid actions for any given game
        Returns:
        an integer array that represents actions that can be taken in a game These combinations range from 1-3 commands at once from the options: NULL, UP, LEFT, DOWN, RIGHT, SPACE 18 Total Actions
